definition: to fish for/to seek profit (by improper means)

sentences.english: But corrupt public officials used this as an advantage.
sentences.chinese: 但腐败的公职人员却以此来捞取好处。

sentences.english: The implication is to curry favour, benefits from fish.
sentences.chinese: 阿谀奉承，其言外之意就是要从中捞取好处。

sentences.english: A dredger is a boat or a device which is used to dredge rivers.
sentences.chinese: 挖泥船是用来挖掘或捞取河底物质的船或设备。

sentences.english: A leader fishes for personal interests by taking advantage of his position and power, which can be described as corruption.
sentences.chinese: 举印者利用手中的权力去捞取个人私利，这就叫腐败。

sentences.english: Are you itching to profit from the falling dollar?
sentences.chinese: 你是否心痒难熬地要从美元的下跌中捞取好处呀？

definition: to seek/to strive for/to obtain/see also 牟取[mou2 qu3]
(coll.) to gain profit (usu. by underhand means)
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain/also written 渾水摸魚|浑水摸鱼
lit. to dredge for money/to make money by reprehensible means/to fish for a quick buck
to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/see also 謀取|谋取[mou2 qu3]
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
to profiteer/to gain some underhand advantage
to extract/to squeeze out (juice etc)/(fig.) to exploit
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to rake in (money)/to plunder/to milk people dry
